016
017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle;
024import com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.FloatColors;
025
026import static com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab.ColorfulBatch.*;
027
028/**
029 * Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using {@link ColorfulBatch}. A
030 * ColorfulSprite has a position and a size given as width and height. The position is relative to the origin of the
031 * coordinate system specified via {@link ColorfulBatch#begin()} and the respective matrices. A ColorfulSprite is always
032 * rectangular and its position (x, y) are located in the bottom left corner of that rectangle. A ColorfulSprite also
033 * has an origin around which rotations and scaling are performed (that is, the origin is not modified by rotation and
034 * scaling). The origin is given relative to the bottom left corner of the ColorfulSprite, its position.
035 * @author mzechner
036 * @author Nathan Sweet 
037 * @author Tommy Ettinger
038 */
039public class ColorfulSprite extends TextureRegion {
040        public static final int VERTEX_SIZE = 2 + 1 + 2 + 1;
041        public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 4 * VERTEX_SIZE;
042
043        private final float[] vertices = new float[SPRITE_SIZE];
044        private float x, y;
045        private float width, height;
046        private float originX, originY;
047        private float rotation;
048        private float scaleX = 1, scaleY = 1;
049        private boolean dirty = true;
050        private Rectangle bounds;
051
052        /** Creates an uninitialized sprite. The sprite will need a texture region and bounds set before it can be drawn. */
053        public ColorfulSprite() {
054                setTweakedColor(Palette.GRAY, TWEAK_RESET);
055        }
056
057        /** Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the size of the texture. 
058         * @param texture A Texture that will be used in full for this ColorfulSprite.
059         */
060        public ColorfulSprite(Texture texture) {
061                this(texture, 0, 0, texture.getWidth(), texture.getHeight());
062        }
063
064        /** Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size. The texture region's upper left corner
065         * will be 0,0.
066         * @param texture A Texture that will have some of its area used for this ColorfulSprite, starting at 0,0 in the upper left.
067         * @param srcWidth The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
068         * @param srcHeight The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn. */
069        public ColorfulSprite(Texture texture, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
070                this(texture, 0, 0, srcWidth, srcHeight);
071        }
072
073        /** Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size.
074         * @param texture A Texture that will have some of its area used for this ColorfulSprite, starting at srcX,srcY in the upper left.
075         * @param srcX The x-coordinate for the upper left corner of the region to use.
076         * @param srcY The y-coordinate for the upper left corner of the region to use.
077         * @param srcWidth The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
078         * @param srcHeight The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn. */
079        public ColorfulSprite(Texture texture, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
080                if (texture == null) throw new IllegalArgumentException("texture cannot be null.");
081                setTexture(texture);
082                setRegion(srcX, srcY, srcWidth, srcHeight);
083                setTweakedColor(Palette.GRAY, TWEAK_RESET);
084                setSize(Math.abs(srcWidth), Math.abs(srcHeight));
085                setOrigin(width * 0.5f, height * 0.5f);
086        }
087
088        /** Creates a sprite based on a specific TextureRegion, the new sprite's region is a copy of the parameter region - altering one
089         * does not affect the other
090         * @param region A TextureRegion that will have relevant data copied into this ColorfulSprite.
091         */
092        public ColorfulSprite(TextureRegion region) {
093                setRegion(region);
094                setTweakedColor(Palette.GRAY, TWEAK_RESET);
095                setSize(region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
096                setOrigin(width * 0.5f, height * 0.5f);
097        }
098
099        /** Creates a sprite with width, height, and texture region equal to the specified size, relative to specified sprite's texture
100         * region.
101         * @param region A TextureRegion that this will use for its Texture and as a basis for the relative coordinates in that Texture.
102         * @param srcX Number of pixels to add to the texture coordinates of {@code region} on the x-axis.
103         * @param srcY Number of pixels to add to the texture coordinates of {@code region} on the y-axis. 
104         * @param srcWidth The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
105         * @param srcHeight The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn. */
106        public ColorfulSprite(TextureRegion region, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
107                setRegion(region, srcX, srcY, srcWidth, srcHeight);
108                setTweakedColor(Palette.GRAY, TWEAK_RESET);
109                setSize(Math.abs(srcWidth), Math.abs(srcHeight));
110                setOrigin(width * 0.5f, height * 0.5f);
111        }
112
113        /** Creates a colorfulSprite that is a copy in every way of the specified colorfulSprite. 
114         * @param colorfulSprite A ColorfulSprite that will be copied exactly.
115         */
116        public ColorfulSprite(ColorfulSprite colorfulSprite) {
117                set(colorfulSprite);
118        }
119
120        /** Make this colorfulSprite a copy in every way of the specified colorfulSprite
121         * @param colorfulSprite A ColorfulSprite that will be copied exactly.
122         */
123        public void set (ColorfulSprite colorfulSprite) {
124                if (colorfulSprite == null) throw new IllegalArgumentException("colorfulSprite cannot be null.");
125                System.arraycopy(colorfulSprite.vertices, 0, vertices, 0, SPRITE_SIZE);
126                setRegion(colorfulSprite);
127                x = colorfulSprite.x;
128                y = colorfulSprite.y;
129                width = colorfulSprite.width;
130                height = colorfulSprite.height;
131                setRegionWidth(colorfulSprite.getRegionWidth());
132                setRegionHeight(colorfulSprite.getRegionHeight());
133                originX = colorfulSprite.originX;
134                originY = colorfulSprite.originY;
135                rotation = colorfulSprite.rotation;
136                scaleX = colorfulSprite.scaleX;
137                scaleY = colorfulSprite.scaleY;
138                setTweakedColor(colorfulSprite.vertices[C1], colorfulSprite.vertices[T1]);
139                if(colorfulSprite.bounds != null)
140                        bounds = new Rectangle(colorfulSprite.bounds);
141                dirty = colorfulSprite.dirty;
142        }
143
144        /** Sets the position and size of the sprite when drawn, before scaling and rotation are applied. If origin, rotation, or scale
145         * are changed, it is slightly more efficient to set the bounds after those operations. 
146         * @param x The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
147         * @param y The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
148         * @param width The width to display the ColorfulSprite with. 
149         * @param height The height to display the ColorfulSprite with.
150         */
151        public void setBounds (float x, float y, float width, float height) {
152                this.x = x;
153                this.y = y;
154                this.width = width;
155                this.height = height;
156
157                if (dirty) return;
158
159                float x2 = x + width;
160                float y2 = y + height;
161                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
162                vertices[X1] = x;
163                vertices[Y1] = y;
164
165                vertices[X2] = x;
166                vertices[Y2] = y2;
167
168                vertices[X3] = x2;
169                vertices[Y3] = y2;
170
171                vertices[X4] = x2;
172                vertices[Y4] = y;
173
174                if (rotation != 0 || scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) dirty = true;
175        }
176
177        /** Sets the size of the sprite when drawn, before scaling and rotation are applied. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed,
178         * it is slightly more efficient to set the size after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is
179         * better to use {@link #setBounds(float, float, float, float)}.
180         * @param width The width to display the ColorfulSprite with. 
181         * @param height The height to display the ColorfulSprite with.
182         */
183        public void setSize (float width, float height) {
184                this.width = width;
185                this.height = height;
186
187                if (dirty) return;
188
189                float x2 = x + width;
190                float y2 = y + height;
191                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
192                vertices[X1] = x;
193                vertices[Y1] = y;
194
195                vertices[X2] = x;
196                vertices[Y2] = y2;
197
198                vertices[X3] = x2;
199                vertices[Y3] = y2;
200
201                vertices[X4] = x2;
202                vertices[Y4] = y;
203
204                if (rotation != 0 || scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) dirty = true;
205        }
206
207        /** Sets the position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient
208         * to set the position after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is better to use
209         * {@link #setBounds(float, float, float, float)}. 
210         * @param x The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
211         * @param y The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
212         */
213        public void setPosition (float x, float y) {
214                translate(x - this.x, y - this.y);
215        }
216
217        /** Sets the position where the sprite will be drawn, relative to its current origin. 
218         * @param x The adjustment to make to the x-position, relative to the current origin. 
219         * @param y The adjustment to make to the y-position, relative to the current origin. 
220         */
221        public void setOriginBasedPosition (float x, float y) {
222                setPosition(x - this.originX, y - this.originY);
223        }
224
225        /** Sets the x position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient
226         * to set the position after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is better to use
227         * {@link #setBounds(float, float, float, float)}.
228         * @param x The x-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
229         */
230        public void setX (float x) {
231                translateX(x - this.x);
232        }
233
234        /** Sets the y position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are changed, it is slightly more efficient
235         * to set the position after those operations. If both position and size are to be changed, it is better to use
236         * {@link #setBounds(float, float, float, float)}.
237         * @param y The y-position of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
238         */
239        public void setY (float y) {
240                translateY(y - this.y);
241        }
242        
243        /** Sets the x position so that it is centered on the given x parameter.
244         * @param x The x-position of the center of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
245         */
246        public void setCenterX (float x) {
247                setX(x - width * 0.5f);
248        }
249
250        /** Sets the y position so that it is centered on the given y parameter.
251         * @param y The y-position of the center of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
252         */
253        public void setCenterY (float y) {
254                setY(y - height * 0.5f);
255        }
256
257        /** Sets the position so that the sprite is centered on (x, y).
258         * @param x The x-position of the center of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
259         * @param y The y-position of the center of the ColorfulSprite in world space.
260         */
261        public void setCenter (float x, float y) {
262                setCenterX(x);
263                setCenterY(y);
264        }
265
266        /** Sets the x position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are
267         * changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations.
268         * @param xAmount How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the x-axis, in world space.
269         */
270        public void translateX (float xAmount) {
271                this.x += xAmount;
272
273                if (dirty) return;
274
275                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
276                vertices[X1] += xAmount;
277                vertices[X2] += xAmount;
278                vertices[X3] += xAmount;
279                vertices[X4] += xAmount;
280        }
281
282        /** Sets the y position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are
283         * changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations. 
284         * @param yAmount How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the y-axis, in world space.
285         */
286        public void translateY (float yAmount) {
287                y += yAmount;
288
289                if (dirty) return;
290
291                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
292                vertices[Y1] += yAmount;
293                vertices[Y2] += yAmount;
294                vertices[Y3] += yAmount;
295                vertices[Y4] += yAmount;
296        }
297
298        /** Sets the position relative to the current position where the sprite will be drawn. If origin, rotation, or scale are
299         * changed, it is slightly more efficient to translate after those operations.
300         * @param xAmount How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the x-axis, in world space.
301         * @param yAmount How much to move the ColorfulSprite on the y-axis, in world space.
302         */
303        public void translate (float xAmount, float yAmount) {
304                x += xAmount;
305                y += yAmount;
306
307                if (dirty) return;
308
309                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
310                vertices[X1] += xAmount;
311                vertices[Y1] += yAmount;
312
313                vertices[X2] += xAmount;
314                vertices[Y2] += yAmount;
315
316                vertices[X3] += xAmount;
317                vertices[Y3] += yAmount;
318
319                vertices[X4] += xAmount;
320                vertices[Y4] += yAmount;
321        }
322
323        /** Sets the color used to tint this sprite. Default is {@link Palette#GRAY}, which makes no changes to the color.
324         * Use {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)} or a predefined color from {@link Palette} if you
325         * don't have a color currently.
326         * @param color the packed float color used to add to the L/A/B channels of the current sprite, as well as the multiplier for alpha
327         */
328        public void setColor (final float color) {
329                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
330                vertices[C1] = color;
331                vertices[C2] = color;
332                vertices[C3] = color;
333                vertices[C4] = color;
334        }
335
336        /** Sets the color used to tint this sprite and the tweak that affects how that color will be treated.
337         * Default color is {@link Palette#GRAY}, which makes no changes to the color, and default tweak is
338         * {@link ColorfulBatch#TWEAK_RESET}, which resets any changes to the tweak back to a neutral state. You can easily
339         * get a tweak value with {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}, just using the last parameter
340         * to represent contrast.
341         * @param color the packed float color used to add to the L/A/B channels of the current sprite, as well as the multiplier for alpha
342         * @param tweak the packed float used to multiply the L/A/B channels, as well as the setting for contrast
343         */
344        public void setTweakedColor (final float color, final float tweak) {
345                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
346                vertices[C1] = color;
347                vertices[C2] = color;
348                vertices[C3] = color;
349                vertices[C4] = color;
350                vertices[T1] = tweak;
351                vertices[T2] = tweak;
352                vertices[T3] = tweak;
353                vertices[T4] = tweak;
354        }
355
356        /** Sets the color used to tint this sprite and the tweak that affects how that color will be treated.
357         * Default color is {@link Palette#GRAY}, which makes no changes to the color, and default tweak is
358         * {@link ColorfulBatch#TWEAK_RESET}, which resets any changes to the tweak back to a neutral state. You can easily
359         * get a tweak value with {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}, just using the last parameter
360         * to represent contrast.
361         * @param addL how much lightness to add; darkest is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, lightest is 1f
362         * @param addA how much to add on the cyan/red axis; more cyan is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, more red is 1f
363         * @param addB how much to add on the blue/yellow axis; more blue is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, more yellow is 1f
364         * @param mulAlpha how much to multiply alpha by; fully transparent is 0f, neutral is 1f
365         * @param mulL how much source lightness should be multiplied by; darkest is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, lightest is 1f
366         * @param mulA how much the source's cyan/red axis should be multiplied by; no cyan/red is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, max cyan/red is 1f
367         * @param mulB how much the source's blue/yellow axis should be multiplied by; no blue/yellow is 0f, neutral is 0.5f, max blue/yellow is 1f
368         * @param contrast how to affect the curvature of lightness in the source; 0f makes lightness very even, 0.5f doesn't change lightness, and 1f makes light colors lighter and dark colors darker
369         */
370        public void setTweakedColor (float addL, float addA, float addB, float mulAlpha, float mulL, float mulA, float mulB, float contrast) {
371                final float color = ColorTools.cielab(addL, addA, addB, mulAlpha),
372                                tweak = ColorTools.cielab(mulL, mulA, mulB, contrast);
373                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
374                vertices[C1] = color;
375                vertices[C2] = color;
376                vertices[C3] = color;
377                vertices[C4] = color;
378                vertices[T1] = tweak;
379                vertices[T2] = tweak;
380                vertices[T3] = tweak;
381                vertices[T4] = tweak;
382        }
383
384        /** Sets the tweak that affects how the rendered color will be treated.
385         * Default tweak is {@link ColorfulBatch#TWEAK_RESET}, which resets any changes to the tweak back to a neutral
386         * state. You can easily get a tweak value with {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}, just
387         * using the last parameter to represent contrast.
388         * @param tweak the packed float used to multiply the L/A/B channels, as well as the setting for contrast
389         */
390        public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
391                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
392                vertices[T1] = tweak;
393                vertices[T2] = tweak;
394                vertices[T3] = tweak;
395                vertices[T4] = tweak;
396        }
397
398        /**
399         * Given an RGBA8888 Color from libGDX, this converts that to an Oklab color as a packed float and sets the color of
400         * the sprite using that.
401         * @param color a libGDX RGBA8888 Color
402         */
403        public void setColor (Color color) {
404                setColor(ColorTools.fromColor(color));
405        }
406
407        /** Sets the alpha portion of the color used to tint this sprite. */
408        public void setAlpha (float a) {
409                final float color = FloatColors.setAlpha(getColor(), a);
410                final float[] vertices = this.vertices;
411                vertices[C1] = color;
412                vertices[C2] = color;
413                vertices[C3] = color;
414                vertices[C4] = color;
415        }
416
417        /** @see #setColor(float) */
418        public void setColor (float L, float A, float B, float alpha) {
419                final float color = ColorTools.cielab(L, A, B, alpha);
420                final float[] vertices = this.vertices;
421                vertices[C1] = color;
422                vertices[C2] = color;
423                vertices[C3] = color;
424                vertices[C4] = color;
425        }
426
427        /** @see #setTweak(float) */
428        public void setTweak (float L, float A, float B, float contrast) {
429                final float tweak = ColorTools.cielab(L, A, B, contrast);
430                final float[] vertices = this.vertices;
431                vertices[C1] = tweak;
432                vertices[C2] = tweak;
433                vertices[C3] = tweak;
434                vertices[C4] = tweak;
435        }
436
437        /** Exactly the same as {@link #setColor(float)}.
438         * @see #setColor(float) 
439         */
440        public void setPackedColor (float packedColor) {
441                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
442                vertices[C1] = packedColor;
443                vertices[C2] = packedColor;
444                vertices[C3] = packedColor;
445                vertices[C4] = packedColor;
446        }
447
448        /** Sets the origin in relation to the sprite's position for scaling and rotation. */
449        public void setOrigin (float originX, float originY) {
450                this.originX = originX;
451                this.originY = originY;
452                dirty = true;
453        }
454
455        /** Place origin in the center of the sprite */
456        public void setOriginCenter() {
457                this.originX = width * 0.5f;
458                this.originY = height * 0.5f;
459                dirty = true;
460        }
461
462        /** Sets the rotation of the sprite in degrees. Rotation is centered on the origin set in {@link #setOrigin(float, float)} */
463        public void setRotation (float degrees) {
464                this.rotation = degrees;
465                dirty = true;
466        }
467
468        /** @return the rotation of the sprite in degrees */
469        public float getRotation () {
470                return rotation;
471        }
472
473        /** Sets the sprite's rotation in degrees relative to the current rotation. Rotation is centered on the origin set in
474         * {@link #setOrigin(float, float)} */
475        public void rotate (float degrees) {
476                if (degrees == 0) return;
477                rotation += degrees;
478                dirty = true;
479        }
480
481        /** Rotates this sprite 90 degrees in-place by rotating the texture coordinates. This rotation is unaffected by
482         * {@link #setRotation(float)} and {@link #rotate(float)}. */
483        public void rotate90 (boolean clockwise) {
484                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
485
486                if (clockwise) {
487                        float temp = vertices[V1];
488                        vertices[V1] = vertices[V4];
489                        vertices[V4] = vertices[V3];
490                        vertices[V3] = vertices[V2];
491                        vertices[V2] = temp;
492
493                        temp = vertices[U1];
494                        vertices[U1] = vertices[U4];
495                        vertices[U4] = vertices[U3];
496                        vertices[U3] = vertices[U2];
497                        vertices[U2] = temp;
498                } else {
499                        float temp = vertices[V1];
500                        vertices[V1] = vertices[V2];
501                        vertices[V2] = vertices[V3];
502                        vertices[V3] = vertices[V4];
503                        vertices[V4] = temp;
504
505                        temp = vertices[U1];
506                        vertices[U1] = vertices[U2];
507                        vertices[U2] = vertices[U3];
508                        vertices[U3] = vertices[U4];
509                        vertices[U4] = temp;
510                }
511        }
512
513        /** Sets the sprite's scale for both X and Y uniformly. The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values
514         * returned by {@link #getWidth()} and {@link #getHeight()} */
515        public void setScale (float scaleXY) {
516                this.scaleX = scaleXY;
517                this.scaleY = scaleXY;
518                dirty = true;
519        }
520
521        /** Sets the sprite's scale for both X and Y. The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values returned by
522         * {@link #getWidth()} and {@link #getHeight()} */
523        public void setScale (float scaleX, float scaleY) {
524                this.scaleX = scaleX;
525                this.scaleY = scaleY;
526                dirty = true;
527        }
528
529        /** Sets the sprite's scale relative to the current scale. for example: original scale 2  sprite.scale(4)  final scale 6.
530         * The sprite scales out from the origin. This will not affect the values returned by {@link #getWidth()} and
531         * {@link #getHeight()} */
532        public void scale (float amount) {
533                this.scaleX += amount;
534                this.scaleY += amount;
535                dirty = true;
536        }
537
538        /** Returns the packed vertices, colors, and texture coordinates for this sprite. */
539        public float[] getVertices () {
540                if (dirty) {
541                        dirty = false;
542
543                        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
544                        float localX = -originX;
545                        float localY = -originY;
546                        float localX2 = localX + width;
547                        float localY2 = localY + height;
548                        float worldOriginX = this.x - localX;
549                        float worldOriginY = this.y - localY;
550                        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
551                                localX *= scaleX;
552                                localY *= scaleY;
553                                localX2 *= scaleX;
554                                localY2 *= scaleY;
555                        }
556                        if (rotation != 0) {
557                                final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
558                                final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
559                                final float localXCos = localX * cos;
560                                final float localXSin = localX * sin;
561                                final float localYCos = localY * cos;
562                                final float localYSin = localY * sin;
563                                final float localX2Cos = localX2 * cos;
564                                final float localX2Sin = localX2 * sin;
565                                final float localY2Cos = localY2 * cos;
566                                final float localY2Sin = localY2 * sin;
567
568                                final float x1 = localXCos - localYSin + worldOriginX;
569                                final float y1 = localYCos + localXSin + worldOriginY;
570                                vertices[X1] = x1;
571                                vertices[Y1] = y1;
572
573                                final float x2 = localXCos - localY2Sin + worldOriginX;
574                                final float y2 = localY2Cos + localXSin + worldOriginY;
575                                vertices[X2] = x2;
576                                vertices[Y2] = y2;
577
578                                final float x3 = localX2Cos - localY2Sin + worldOriginX;
579                                final float y3 = localY2Cos + localX2Sin + worldOriginY;
580                                vertices[X3] = x3;
581                                vertices[Y3] = y3;
582
583                                vertices[X4] = x1 + (x3 - x2);
584                                vertices[Y4] = y3 - (y2 - y1);
585                        } else {
586                                final float x1 = localX + worldOriginX;
587                                final float y1 = localY + worldOriginY;
588                                final float x2 = localX2 + worldOriginX;
589                                final float y2 = localY2 + worldOriginY;
590
591                                vertices[X1] = x1;
592                                vertices[Y1] = y1;
593
594                                vertices[X2] = x1;
595                                vertices[Y2] = y2;
596
597                                vertices[X3] = x2;
598                                vertices[Y3] = y2;
599
600                                vertices[X4] = x2;
601                                vertices[Y4] = y1;
602                        }
603                }
604                return vertices;
605        }
606
607        /** Returns the bounding axis aligned {@link Rectangle} that bounds this sprite. The rectangles x and y coordinates describe its
608         * bottom left corner. If you change the position or size of the sprite, you have to fetch the triangle again for it to be
609         * recomputed.
610         * 
611         * @return the bounding Rectangle */
612        public Rectangle getBoundingRectangle () {
613                final float[] vertices = getVertices();
614
615                float minx = vertices[X1];
616                float miny = vertices[Y1];
617                float maxx = vertices[X1];
618                float maxy = vertices[Y1];
619
620                minx = Math.min(minx, vertices[X2]);
621                minx = Math.min(minx, vertices[X3]);
622                minx = Math.min(minx, vertices[X4]);
623
624                maxx = Math.max(maxx, vertices[X2]);
625                maxx = Math.max(maxx, vertices[X3]);
626                maxx = Math.max(maxx, vertices[X4]);
627
628                miny = Math.min(miny, vertices[Y2]);
629                miny = Math.min(miny, vertices[Y3]);
630                miny = Math.min(miny, vertices[Y4]);
631
632                maxy = Math.max(maxy, vertices[Y2]);
633                maxy = Math.max(maxy, vertices[Y3]);
634                maxy = Math.max(maxy, vertices[Y4]);
635
636                if (bounds == null) bounds = new Rectangle();
637                bounds.x = minx;
638                bounds.y = miny;
639                bounds.width = maxx - minx;
640                bounds.height = maxy - miny;
641                return bounds;
642        }
643
644        public void draw (ColorfulBatch batch) {
645                batch.drawExactly(getTexture(), getVertices(), 0, SPRITE_SIZE);
646        }
647
648        public void draw (ColorfulBatch batch, float alphaModulation) {
649                final float oldAlpha = ColorTools.alpha(getColor());
650                setAlpha(oldAlpha * alphaModulation);
651                draw(batch);
652                setAlpha(oldAlpha);
653        }
654        
655        public float getX () {
656                return x;
657        }
658
659        public float getY () {
660                return y;
661        }
662
663        /** @return the width of the sprite, not accounting for scale. */
664        public float getWidth () {
665                return width;
666        }
667
668        /** @return the height of the sprite, not accounting for scale. */
669        public float getHeight () {
670                return height;
671        }
672
673        /** The origin influences {@link #setPosition(float, float)}, {@link #setRotation(float)} and the expansion direction of scaling
674         * {@link #setScale(float, float)} */
675        public float getOriginX () {
676                return originX;
677        }
678
679        /** The origin influences {@link #setPosition(float, float)}, {@link #setRotation(float)} and the expansion direction of scaling
680         * {@link #setScale(float, float)} */
681        public float getOriginY () {
682                return originY;
683        }
684
685        /** X scale of the sprite, independent of size set by {@link #setSize(float, float)} */
686        public float getScaleX () {
687                return scaleX;
688        }
689
690        /** Y scale of the sprite, independent of size set by {@link #setSize(float, float)} */
691        public float getScaleY () {
692                return scaleY;
693        }
694
695        /** Returns the color of this sprite. If the returned instance is manipulated, {@link #setColor(float)} must be called
696         * afterward.
697         * @return a packed float color used to add to the L/A/B channels of the current sprite, as well as the multiplier for alpha
698         */
699        public float getColor () {
700                return vertices[C1];
701        }
702
703        /**
704         * Returns the multiplicative color tweaks used by this sprite, as a packed float with the same format as a color.
705         * @return a packed float used to multiply the L/A/B channels, as well as the setting for contrast
706         */
707        public float getColorTweak () {
708                return vertices[T1];
709        }
710
711        public void setRegion (float u, float v, float u2, float v2) {
712                super.setRegion(u, v, u2, v2);
713
714                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
715                vertices[U1] = u;
716                vertices[V1] = v2;
717
718                vertices[U2] = u;
719                vertices[V2] = v;
720
721                vertices[U3] = u2;
722                vertices[V3] = v;
723
724                vertices[U4] = u2;
725                vertices[V4] = v2;
726        }
727
728        public void setU (float u) {
729                super.setU(u);
730                vertices[U1] = u;
731                vertices[U2] = u;
732        }
733
734        public void setV (float v) {
735                super.setV(v);
736                vertices[V2] = v;
737                vertices[V3] = v;
738        }
739
740        public void setU2 (float u2) {
741                super.setU2(u2);
742                vertices[U3] = u2;
743                vertices[U4] = u2;
744        }
745
746        public void setV2 (float v2) {
747                super.setV2(v2);
748                vertices[V1] = v2;
749                vertices[V4] = v2;
750        }
751
752        /** Set the sprite's flip state regardless of current condition
753         * @param x the desired horizontal flip state
754         * @param y the desired vertical flip state */
755        public void setFlip (boolean x, boolean y) {
756                boolean performX = false;
757                boolean performY = false;
758                if (isFlipX() != x) {
759                        performX = true;
760                }
761                if (isFlipY() != y) {
762                        performY = true;
763                }
764                flip(performX, performY);
765        }
766
767        /** boolean parameters x,y are not setting a state, but performing a flip
768         * @param x perform horizontal flip
769         * @param y perform vertical flip */
770        public void flip (boolean x, boolean y) {
771                super.flip(x, y);
772                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
773                if (x) {
774                        float temp = vertices[U1];
775                        vertices[U1] = vertices[U3];
776                        vertices[U3] = temp;
777                        temp = vertices[U2];
778                        vertices[U2] = vertices[U4];
779                        vertices[U4] = temp;
780                }
781                if (y) {
782                        float temp = vertices[V1];
783                        vertices[V1] = vertices[V3];
784                        vertices[V3] = temp;
785                        temp = vertices[V2];
786                        vertices[V2] = vertices[V4];
787                        vertices[V4] = temp;
788                }
789        }
790
791        public void scroll (float xAmount, float yAmount) {
792                float[] vertices = this.vertices;
793                if (xAmount != 0) {
794                        float u = (vertices[U1] + xAmount) % 1;
795                        float u2 = u + width / getTexture().getWidth();
796                        setU(u);
797                        setU2(u2);
798                        vertices[U1] = u;
799                        vertices[U2] = u;
800                        vertices[U3] = u2;
801                        vertices[U4] = u2;
802                }
803                if (yAmount != 0) {
804                        float v = (vertices[V2] + yAmount) % 1;
805                        float v2 = v + height / getTexture().getHeight();
806                        setV(v);
807                        setV2(v2);
808                        vertices[V1] = v2;
809                        vertices[V2] = v;
810                        vertices[V3] = v;
811                        vertices[V4] = v2;
812                }
813        }
814}
